climbs.name: Your gear is no good here

content.description: the line is cool the rock sounds hollow! if top roped you can climb this and "just a cent" on one rope.
content.protection: pretty  small if I remember correctly. even passive will most likely be fine but remember hollow sounding rock.
content.location: behind chockstone tower to the left of just a cent.

content.description: The low angle slab on the west side of the tower.
content.protection: Brass nuts to larger nuts plus a couple small cams.
content.location: Start on right side of slab.  The route itself follows the protection opportunities.

content.description: Face climb up to the break in the overhang about 10 feet from "The Bitch" towards the top reconnect with "The Bitch" to top out.
content.protection: top rope   Trad Small cams, Stopper Set, 2-3 slings. Medium to Large Cam for nice clean crack to anchor at top.

content.description: Climb tough first move over the northwest corner overhang and then climb to the top.
content.protection: Top Rope placement good scramble up west slab (5.3)

content.description: The bottom is a bit rocky so a pad might be nice other than that just follow the crack.
content.protection: a #4 is nice, hexes or cams.
content.location: the route is on the back of chockstone tower and starts just to the right of the usual way to the top

content.description: Just to the right of " The Son Of A Bitch" climb directly over overhang and proceed slightly to the right.
the crux is low the rock is good and I wish it was longer.
content.protection: I think I placed a 4 and a 1 also a small guy off the ground.
content.location: behind chockstone tower to the right of "your gear is no good here"

content.description: Start on left wall below the chockstone.  Make a few face moves so your above the chockstone and follow the crack to the top.
content.protection: Finger to hand.  Make sure you have pro for the top anchor.
content.location: Opposite wall of Chockstone Express.  Start below the chockstone.

content.description: This is the Face climb to the west of the northeast corner of Chockstone Tower.
content.protection: Top Rope Placement is good above scramble up the west slab ( 5.3) Trad 2-3 small cams, Stopper set, 2-3 slings.

content.description: It is actually just to the left of the true dihedral with the roof and it is dirty.
content.location: on the wall behind chockstone tower to the left of "your gears no good here"

content.description: trad climbable route starts on top of the chockstone
content.location: se side (back) of tower, finger/hand crack starts on top of chockstone

content.description: Climb the broken face with a series of small ledges finishing out with a broken crack.    Scramble up beginning broken face. A horn can be slung followed by passive gear from there. The crux is a few moves of 5.7 about half way up after gaining a ledge. Watch for hollow/loose rock if leading.
content.protection: Small to standard set of stoppers, hexes and a few slings depending on how much gear you set.
content.location: Around the corner, to climbers left of Henry Aaron. Face climb eight feet right of Chockstone Express.

content.description: Do overhanging face to the left of " The Bitch" towards the top gets really crazy with little overhangs and pointy rock formations.
content.protection: Top Rope or Trad Top Rope placement can be set up by scrambling up " West Slab" 5.3 to place gear.

content.description: Chockstone Tower is an ultra classic tower in Palisades State Park. Many fun routes up it. Routes vary from the "West Slab Route"5.3 to "Aloha" 5.12. Great Dihedral is " The Bitch " 5.8-5.9? This tower also has some fun face climbs. Split Rock Creek roars less than 20 feet away so as you climb all you can really hear is the river a fun intense climb.
